userInput.promptText: Please provide a reason why you are proceeding without a written plan

fields.name: confirm_header
fields.fieldText:
{!recordId.Name} has been successfully moved to {!recordId.Stage__c}.


Please add any relevant Technical Assets (i.e. custom demos, prototypes / apps, presentations, etc.) using the Add Technical Asset button


Additionally, please file any Product Feature Requests (PFRs) via the PFR app


If you have already added all Technical Assets to this evaluation, you may close this modal.

fields.name: error_hosting_provider
fields.fieldText: Error: Production Hosting Provider is required when evaluation includes Self-hosted or Air-gapped.

fields.name: header_to_eval
fields.fieldText: To advance {!recordId.Name} to the Evaluation stage, please review or complete the following:

fields.name: Evaluation_Summary
fields.helpText: A brief summary of the evaluation and any key deal highlights

fields.name: Evaluation_Risks
fields.helpText: Any identified deal risks (e.g. no executive alignment, limited urgency, APIs not yet built out, low skill builders, etc.)

validationRule.errorMessage: Must be <= 4000 characters

fields.name: Technical_Stakeholders_eval
fields.helpText: Include Name and Role of key technical stakeholders

fields.name: eval_types_help_a
fields.fieldText:
Evaluation Types:

Comprehensive Demo: Stage 4 demo using pre-built assets

Custom Demo: Stage 4 demo using a prototype built for the customer

Low-Touch POC: 1-2 week POC with 2-3 check-ins

Workshop: 1-2 day, 3-4 hour sprint validation session(s)

High-Touch POC: 2-4 week POC with numerous check-ins

Self-led: Customer-led evaluation with asynchronous Retool support

fields.name: skill_level_eval
fields.helpText:
Low: Builders did not build in Retool and do not have technical proficiency to build on Retool 

Medium: Builders did not build in Retool but have the skillset to build in Retool (JS/SQL/APIs) or they have built in Retool but proficiency is still lacking (ex. not regularly using JS or need help with code gen)

High: Builders built in Retool pre-sale or from a previous job. They are familiar with building in Retool and are proficient in front-end building due to their role (SWE, Developer, etc)

fields.name: Skill_Level_Details_eval
fields.helpText: Context on the skill level of the people managing and building in Retool, e.g. discrepancy in deployment vs. app building skill level or in different team skill level, where teams need help, etc.

fields.name: header_to_eval_0
fields.fieldText: To advance {!recordId.Name} to the Won stage, please review the following:

fields.name: close_date2
fields.fieldText: Close Date: On what date did the technical evaluation conclude?

validationRule.errorMessage: Date must be on or after the start of Evaluation ({!recordId.Evaluation_Start_Date__c}) and on or before today.

fields.name: Evaluation_Types
fields.helpText: List any evaluation types leveraged. More information about each can be found in the Evaluation Playbook.

fields.name: eval_types_help
fields.fieldText:
Evaluation Types:

Comprehensive Demo: Stage 4 demo using pre-built assets

Custom Demo: Stage 4 demo using a prototype built for the customer

Low-Touch POC: 1-2 week POC with 2-3 check-ins

Workshop: 1-2 day, 3-4 hour sprint validation session(s)

High-Touch POC: 2-4 week POC with numerous check-ins

Self-led: Customer evaluation without Retool guidance

fields.name: Identified_Use_Cases
fields.helpText: The use cases/apps the team is planning to roll out, and their priority, primary builders, teams, and end user details. Include links to relevant Gong calls or app specs/details.

fields.name: Use_Case_Complexity
fields.helpText: Details on any use case complexity, e.g. migration from an existing tool, complex workflow, APIs need to be built out, etc.

fields.name: Use_Case_Progress
fields.helpText: Indicate the work completed on the Identified Use Cases during the evaluation, and what was built by the customer vs. Retool.

fields.name: Deployment_Progress
fields.helpText: How much of the deployment - including SSO/source control, externalized storage DB, and resource setup - is completed, which steps must be done post-sale, and if the customer is deploying differently in production than they did during the evaluation.

fields.name: Skill_Level
fields.helpText:
Low: Builders did not build in Retool and do not have technical proficiency to build on Retool 

Medium: Builders did not build in Retool but have the skillset to build in Retool (JS/SQL/APIs) or they have built in Retool but proficiency is still lacking (ex. not regularly using JS or need help with code gen)

High: Builders built in Retool pre-sale or from a previous job. They are familiar with building in Retool and are proficient in front-end building due to their role (SWE, Developer, etc)

fields.name: Skill_Level_Details
fields.helpText: Context on the skill level of the people managing and building in Retool, e.g. discrepancy in deployment vs. app building skill level or in different team skill level, where teams need help, etc.

fields.name: Production_Risks
fields.helpText: Any blockers or risks to productionized deployment and use case implementation, (e.g. no direct access to IT team, migration to new idP, complex resource auth or connection issues, low skill builders, etc.)

fields.name: forecast_header
fields.fieldText: To advance to the next stage, please update this Technical Evaluation's forecast:

validationRule.errorMessage: Close date must be today or in the future

fields.name: screen_Forecast_Details
fields.helpText: Date & brief overview of evaluation status and any forecast risks

validationRule.errorMessage: Next step date must be today or in the future
